channel.title: Adding Music 100% On A Private Server [COMMUNITY PROJECT]
channel.description:
This is a community project...
This means, if you want to help, you can, and if you do, you will get credits, and the final released code.
Okay, for those who have no idea what I am talking about, this is it:
I have not been on a private server were it has every runescape song correctly placed per city/area.
Dealing with Frame74 or the music frame, we will construct a flawless music system...
I will show you what I have so far...
Public int Mon = 0;(using this for Music On/Off)
The Frame74 code(will not release, ask someone for it, if Prima allows me, I will release the code they gave me)
if (IsInLumbridge() && Mon != 0){ frame74(76);//I think this is called Autumn voyage or what ever... }
Simple Eh?
Wrong..Even though the song's are imported through the client, it doesn't seem to want to work...
I also have action buttons putting int Mon to 1...
Well, I gave you some basic help, now contribute.

item.title: Adding Music 100% On A Private Server [COMMUNITY PROJECT]
item.dc:creator: @wolfs_goal wolfs goal
item.description:
@wolfs_goal wrote:

KK, I’ll try this

And I Will Post Your Code…

So, like I said, if you contribute, you will get the code…

Do you want the area regions with the correct music with the ability to turn it on and off?

Cause I have these areas done:

Varrock, Falador, Camelot, Ardougne, Lumbridge, Al-Karid, Duel Arena, Wilderness, Mage Bank, Castle Wars, Varrock Sewers, Edgeville Dungeon, Dwarf Mines and a few others…

Read full topic
item.source: Adding Music 100% On A Private Server [COMMUNITY PROJECT]

item.title: Adding Music 100% On A Private Server [COMMUNITY PROJECT]
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

You have to enable music in the client, before it can be played via sending the ID through the server.

In signlink.java, in your client files, you will see something similar to:

[code] if(midiplay)
{

                midi = s + savereq;
                            try {
                                //System.out.println("Play MIDI " + midi);
                                if (musicSr != null)
                                {
                                    musicSr.stop();
                                    musicSr.close();
                                }
                                musicSr = null;
                                musicS = null;
                                
                                File music = new File(midi);
                                if(music.exists())
                                {
                                    musicS = MidiSystem.getSequence(music);
                                }
                            } catch (Exception ex) {
                                ex.printStackTrace();
                            }
                
                
                midiplay = false;
            
            }[/code]

Replace that, with this:

[code] if (midiplay) {
midi = s + savereq;
try {
if (musicS != null) {
musicSr.stop();
musicSr.close();
}
musicS = null;
musicSr = null;
File music = new File(midi);

                                            if (music.exists()) {
                                                    musicS = MidiSystem.getSequence(music);
                                                    musicSr = MidiSystem.getSequencer();
                                                    musicSr.open();
                                                    musicSr.setSequence(musicS);
                                                    musicSr.start();
                                            }
                                    } catch (Exception ex) {
                                            ex.printStackTrace();
                                    }
                                    midiplay = false;
                            }[/code]

PS: You can post the code that I gave you, it’s fine.

Read full topic
item.source: Adding Music 100% On A Private Server [COMMUNITY PROJECT]

[quote=“Berky-Scape, post:7, topic:335332”]Wooho rock on freaky bro! < from Spongebob lol
Make a video of it I wanna see it.[/quote]

That’s the thing, I have everything set up correctly, but the music doesn’t seem to want to play o.o

If I can get some assistance, I will release my code for the music with all the cities and proper music…

Read full topic
